title: Job’s Complaint to God
summary: Job continues to speak to God directly, questioning why he was created only to suffer. He struggles to understand God’s purposes and accuses God of unjustly targeting him despite his innocence.

faq.question: What is Job’s central complaint here?
faq.answer: That God is treating him unfairly despite knowing he is innocent.

faq.question: How does Job describe God's treatment of him?
faq.answer: As if God created him only to destroy him.
